snippet: While e-readers and multimedia may seem appealing, the idea of replacing an effective learning platform — the paper textbook — with a widely hyped but still unproven one is extremely dangerous.
abstract: Op-Ed article by assistant Prof Justin B Hollander questions wisdom behind Education Secretary Arne Duncan's proposal to replace textbooks with e-readers and multimedia Web sites; contends benefits of digital-learning technologies are unproven and doing away with such an effective learning platform like the paper textbook can be dangerous.
lead_paragraph: While e-readers and multimedia may seem appealing, the idea of replacing an effective learning platform — the paper textbook — with a widely hyped but still unproven one is extremely dangerous.
